intro: Cinnamomum pallescens, commonly known as the white camphor tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its aromatic, dark reddish-brown bark that exudes a strong camphor scent when cut. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are elliptical in shape and have a leathery texture. It produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by elliptical, woody fruits containing a single seed. This species is valued for its medicinal properties and is also used in traditional crafts and as a source of essential oils.
